net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.audio

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.audio.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which encapsulates a Clip, and allows for simple play back and volume/pan control of an audio file.
    Since:
    May 25, 2015, 8:06:38 PM
    Author:
    Christian Bryce Alexander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sound(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
      Creates a Sound with the provided Clip.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Stops this Sound and releases all resources associated with it.
      boolean isPlaying() 
      void loop()
      Loops this Sound from beginning to end continuously, and runs the SoundListener's Thread if it has been set.
      void play()
      Plays this Sound from beginning to end once, and runs the SoundListener's Thread if it has been set.
      void setListener(SoundListener listener)
      Sets the SoundListener for this Sound.
      void setPan(float position)
      Sets the perceived horizontal position of this Sound.
      void setVolume(float volume)
      Sets the volume, or master gain, for this Sound.
      void stop()
      Stops this Sound from playing, regardless of whether or not it was played or looped, and stops the SoundListener's Thread.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
        Creates a Sound with the provided Clip.
        Parameters:
        clip - The Sound to associate with this Sound

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays this Sound from beginning to end once, and runs the SoundListener's Thread if it has been set.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Loops this Sound from beginning to end continuously, and runs the SoundListener's Thread if it has been set.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops this Sound from playing, regardless of whether or not it was played or looped, and stops the SoundListener's Thread.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns:
        true if the Clip is currently running, false otherwise

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float volume)
        Sets the volume, or master gain, for this Sound. The minimum value is -80f, and the maximum is 6.0206f.
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume to set

      • setPan

        public void setPan(float position)
        Sets the perceived horizontal position of this Sound. The minimum value is -1f (left only), and the maximum is 1f (right only).
        Parameters:
        position - The pan position to set

      • setListener

        public void setListener(SoundListener listener)
        Sets the SoundListener for this Sound.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to set

      • close

        public void close()
        Stops this Sound and releases all resources associated with it.
